summary: Updates each object in an array with new data from a corresponding array, based on a specified key

ports.name: Array of objects
ports.text: Input port for the array of objects to be updated. Each object should be structured to accommodate updates based on the key provided.

ports.name: Data per object
ports.text: Data array containing the new values to be set in each object. Each index in this array corresponds to the object at the same index in inArr.

ports.name: Key in each object
ports.text: The key at which to update the data in each object. Supports nested keys using dot notation (e.g., "data.value"). The key should not end with a dot or contain empty segments.

ports.name: Copy Array
ports.text: A boolean value determining whether to modify the original array (false) or to work on a copy of it (true). Default is false.

ports.name: Updated array
ports.text: Output port that emits the updated array of objects. This is either a reference to the modified original array or a new array, depending on the value of inCopy.
